intro: Acinodendron astrotrichum, commonly known as the star-hair acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale in color. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and branching. Acinodendron astrotrichum is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in savanna environments.
